intro: Hymenocrater haussknechtii, commonly known as the Hausknecht's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its stout, woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
